Problem:
Analyze a complex function system where the output at any time \\( t \\) is governed by the integral transformation \\( Z(t) = \\int_0^t e^{A(s-t)} X(s) \\, ds \\), where \\( X(t) \\) is a complex function and A is a constant complex matrix. Consider the effect of an external control \\( u(t) \\) which modifies \\( X(t) \\) as \\( X_u(t) = X(t) + u(t) \\).

If initially \\( X(t) \\) changes from a passive state to a new state without external control, will the outcome \\( Z(T) \\) for \\( T \\) also change in the same manner as \\( X(t) \\)?
Explanation: The transformation of \\( X(t) \\) directly influences output \\( Z(T) \\), as the integral operation accumulates the effect of the changes in \\( X(t) \\) over the interval from 0 to T. Therefore, any variation in \\( X(t) \\) directly impacts \\( Z(T) \\).
